org.chocosolver.solver.objective

Class ObjectiveManager<V extends Variable,N extends Number>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.chocosolver.solver.objective.BoundsManager<N>
      • org.chocosolver.solver.objective.ObjectiveManager<V,N>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - type of objective variable
    N - related to the type of objective variable: if objective is an IntVar, then this is an Integer, if objective is a RealVar, then this is a Double,
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, ICause

    public class ObjectiveManager<V extends Variable,N extends Number>
extends BoundsManager<N>
implements ICause
    Class to monitor the objective function and avoid exploring "worse" solutions
    Since:
    Oct. 2012
    Author:
    Jean-Guillaume Fages, Charles Prud'homme
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected V objective
      The variable to optimize

      • Fields inherited from class org.chocosolver.solver.objective.BoundsManager

        bestProvedLB, bestProvedUB, policy

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ObjectiveManager(IntVar objective, ResolutionPolicy policy, Function<Integer,Integer> cutComputer)
      Creates an optimization manager for an integer objective function (represented by an IntVar) Enables to cut "worse" solutions
      ObjectiveManager(RealVar objective, ResolutionPolicy policy, double precision, Function<N,N> cutComputer)
      Creates an optimization manager for a continuous objective function (represented by a RealVar) Enables to cut "worse" solutions

    • Field Detail

      • objective

        protected final V extends Variable objective
        The variable to optimize

    • Constructor Detail

      • ObjectiveManager

        public ObjectiveManager(IntVar objective,
                        ResolutionPolicy policy,
                        Function<Integer,Integer> cutComputer)
        Creates an optimization manager for an integer objective function (represented by an IntVar) Enables to cut "worse" solutions
        Parameters:
        objective - variable (represent the value of a solution)
        policy - SATISFACTION / MINIMIZATION / MAXIMIZATION
        cutComputer - define how the cut should be updated dynamically

      • ObjectiveManager

        public ObjectiveManager(RealVar objective,
                        ResolutionPolicy policy,
                        double precision,
                        Function<N,N> cutComputer)
        Creates an optimization manager for a continuous objective function (represented by a RealVar) Enables to cut "worse" solutions
        Parameters:
        objective - variable (represent the value of a solution)
        policy - SATISFACTION / MINIMIZATION / MAXIMIZATION
        precision - precision parameter defining the minimum objective improvement between two solutions (avoids wasting time enumerating a huge set of equivalent solutions)
        cutComputer - define how the cut should be updated dynamically

    • Method Detail

      • SAT

        public static ObjectiveManager SAT()
        Create an objective manager for satisfaction problem, ie when no objective is defined
        Returns:
        a no-objective manager (singleton)

      • why

        public boolean why(RuleStore ruleStore,
                   IntVar var,
                   IEventType evt,
                   int value)
        Description copied from interface: ICause
        Add new rules to the rule store
        Specified by:
        why in interface ICause
        Parameters:
        ruleStore - the rule store
        var - the modified variable
        evt - the undergoing event
        value - the value (for REMOVE only)
        Returns:
        true if at least one rule has been added to the rule store

      • setCutComputer

        public void setCutComputer(Function<N,N> aCutComputer)
        Change the way cuts are managed.
        Parameters:
        aCutComputer - a cut computer

      • strictIntVarCutComputer

        public static Function<Integer,Integer> strictIntVarCutComputer(ResolutionPolicy policy)
        Define a strict cut computer where in the next solution to find should be strictly greater than (resp. less) the best solution found so far when maximizing (resp. minimizing) a problem.
        Parameters:
        policy - resolution policy used
        Returns:
        the new cut to consider

      • walkingIntVarCutComputer

        public static Function<Integer,Integer> walkingIntVarCutComputer()
        Define a walking cut computer where in the next solution to find should be greater than (resp. less than) or equal to the best solution found so far when maximizing (resp. minimizing) a problem.
        Returns:
        the new cut to consider

      • strictRealVarCutComputer

        public static Function<Double,Double> strictRealVarCutComputer(ResolutionPolicy policy,
                                                               double precision)
        Define a strict cut computer where in the next solution to find should be strictly greater (resp. lesser) than the best solution found so far when maximizing (resp. minimizing) a problem.
        Parameters:
        policy - resolution policy used
        precision - precision to consider a RealVar as instantiated
        Returns:
        the new cut to consider

      • walkingRealVarCutComputer

        public static Function<Double,Double> walkingRealVarCutComputer()
        Define a walking cut computer where in the next solution to find should be greater than (resp. less than) or equal to the best solution found so far when maximizing (resp. minimizing) a problem.
        Returns:
        the new cut to consider
